alert.note: Alert for Western Pendleton (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 05 at 2:33PM EST until January 07 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THURSDAY TO 10 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 9 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...In Virginia, Western Highland County. In West Virginia, Western Pendleton County. * WHEN...From 3 PM Thursday to 10 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday evening or Friday morning commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow is expected Thursday evening when snowfall rates of 1 inch per hour are possible.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
